column4: Hello, please help before I set fire to my computer and to myself. Here I am yet again trying to do a simple task on Ubuntu and it's been made dificult. I want to rip a CD with Sound Juicer, so I do . . . But its 128kbps quality. I go into change it go through prefrences and go to mp3 go to edit and instead of what any sane person would expect to see eg. drop down menu with bit rates I have GSTREAMER: audio/x-raw-int,rate=44100,channels=2 ! lame name=en

Hello, please help before I set fire to my computer and to myself. Here I am yet again trying to do a simple task on Ubuntu and it's been made dificult. I want to rip a CD with Sound Juicer, so I do . . . But its 128kbps quality. I go into change it go through prefrences and go to mp3 go to edit and instead of what any sane person would expect to see eg. drop down menu with bit rates I have GSTREAMER: audio/x-raw-int,rate=44100,channels=2 ! lame name=en
Has no one in this room EVER used sound juicer to rip a cd above 128 quality>

Does anyone know what I have to change in this . . . GSTREAMER: audio/x-raw-int,rate=44100,channels=2 ! lame name=enc mode=0 vbr-quality=7 ! id3v2mux . Now If in that text I could to get higher bitrate when I rip cd's?
sorry VBR is 6 I copyed wrong
I cannot believe no one in here has ever wanted to rip a cd above 128 k quality
128 k is for tards no doubt about it
took a look at ripper x and you cant change bit rate
Oh . . . Yes your right however the reason I couldn't use it is it doesn't seem to see my cd driver. Other wise that seemed like the most perfect sofrtware
ripperx doesn't seem to have any option to change the drive :(
it has, hidden, see faq 3 http://ripperx.sourceforge.net/faq.html
GOOOOOOOOOOOO RIPPER X! Seems to be doing the job If this CD drive doens't start smokin I will be alright
DUDE>? You there? I need that link to the FAQ you gave me for ripperx
